item.title: Free PlayStation Plus Games For April 2025 Announced
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/free-playstation-plus-games-for-april-2025-announced/

Sony has announced the three games available for free for all PlayStation Plus (PS Plus) subscribers for April 2025 will be RoboCop: Rogue City, The Texas Chainsaw Massacre, Digimon Story: Cyber Sleuth ‚Äì Hacker‚Äôs Memory.

All three games will be available for every active PS Plus member, no matter the tier, starting April 1. Just like past free games, once you add them to your library, they will be available to download at any time if you have an active subscription.

The new games will be available through May 5.

April 2025‚Äôs Free PlayStation Plus Games

Of the three games available in April, RoboCop: Rogue City is the most notable. Recently, a standalone sequel for the game called RoboCop: Rogue City ‚Äì Unfinished Business was announced for a summer 2025 release.

The Texas Chainsaw Massacre was released 2023 and is based on the 1974 film where you play as either a victim or a member of the Slaughter family. Digimon Story: Cyber Sleuth ‚Äì Hacker‚Äôs Memory puts you in the role of Keisuke Amazawa who has been accused of a crime he didn‚Äôt commit.

If you haven‚Äôt yet, there‚Äôs still time to pick up March‚Äôs free games. Until March 31, subscribers can get Dragon Age: The Veilguard, Sonic Colors: Ultimate, and Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: The Cowabunga Collection.

In addition to the new games for PlayStation Plus subscribers, those who are on Extra and Premium memberships received eight new games to the PlayStation Plus Game Catalog in March. Those games include UFC 5 and Prince of Persia: The Lost Crown, among others.

What do you think of the free PlayStation Plus games for April 2025? Let us know down below, and join the discussion in the official Insider Gaming Forums.

item.title: OpTic Texas Repeats History, Drops Pred for Huke Again
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/optic-texas-repeats-history-drops-pred-for-huke-again/

OpTic Gaming announced a major change to their OpTic Texas Call of Duty roster today, but it‚Äôs one fans have seen before. For the second time in just a matter of months, OpTic Texas has removed Amer ‚ÄúPred‚Äù Zulbeari in favor of Cuyler ‚ÄúHuke‚Äù Garland.

Huke In, Pred Out of OpTic Texas to Kick Off Another Call of Duty Rostermania Period

OpTic officially said thank you (and goodbye) to Pred today, thanking him for his ‚Äúpassion and energy.‚Äù Back in December, just months after OpTic Texas claimed the CDL championship, Pred moved to the inactive roster, needing a break to ‚Äúhandle personal issues‚Äù and fix his mental health. Days later though, he confirmed that he was a free agent, though still under contract with OpTic.

A World Champion with passion and energy for the game that is truly special ‚ö° Always a part of our legacy. Thank you @Pred

In his place, Huke returned to the OpTic lineup after being away for more than a year. Following his CDL Championship with Dallas Empire in 2020, Huke had bounced around different spots, picking up stints with LA Thieves, LA Guerillas, the Seattle/Vancouver Surge. OpTic struggled early this season with Huke in the lineup, but even after Pred returned to the starting squad this past February, the results got even worse.

Before the Stage Two Major last weekend, OpTic Texas brought in Cesar ‚ÄúSkyz‚Äù Bueno, after a struggling Kenneth ‚ÄúKenny‚Äù Williams chose to step down. Now after a second major change, the OpTic Texas roster will look ahead to the Stage 3 Major Qualifiers at the start of April. However, don‚Äôt expect OpTic Texas to be the only teams to make roster moves before the next CDL stage begins.

Is this the right call for OpTic Texas? Let us know in the comments or on our community forum!
